audio_emotion¶

Modules¶

audio_emotion.get_argument module¶

get-argument.py docstring This module was created to define the command line level arguments that will be used in this package.

audio_emotion.get_argument.argument()¶

Function to get argument if given by the user Returns ———- The argument namespace

audio_emotion.ingest_data module¶

ingest_data.py docstring

Module created for loading the data needed for the module and to combine them for easier feature extraction.

audio_emotion.ingest_data.load_data(data_path)¶

Function to combine all the loading functions present in this module. The functions are ‘load_data_SAVEE’, ‘load_data_RAVDESS’, ‘load_data_TESS’ and ‘load_data_CREMA’.

Additionally it also creates and saves a reference file containing the emotion and the path of the file.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user.

data_path: StrOrBytesPath

The location where data is to stored(downloaded).

A dataframe having emotion of the speaker categorized along with the file path.

audio_emotion.ingest_data.load_data_CREMA(CREMA)¶

Function to read and load CREMA dataset.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user.

CREMA: StrOrBytesPath

The path where the CREMA data is downloaded.

A dataframe having emotion of the speaker categorized along with the file path.

audio_emotion.ingest_data.load_data_RAVDESS(RAVDESS)¶

Function to read and load RAVDESS dataset.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user.

RAVDESS: StrOrBytesPath

The path where the RAVDESS data is downloaded.

A dataframe having emotion of the speaker categorized along with the file path.

audio_emotion.ingest_data.load_data_SAVEE(SAVEE)¶

Function to read and load SAVEE dataset.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

SAVEE: StrOrBytesPath

The path where the SAVEE data is downloaded.

A dataframe having emotion of the speaker categorized along with the file path.

audio_emotion.ingest_data.load_data_TESS(TESS)¶

Function to read and load TESS dataset.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user.

TESS: StrOrBytesPath

The path where the TESS data is downloaded.

A dataframe having emotion of the speaker categorized along with the file path.

audio_emotion.logging_setup module¶

logging_setup.py docstring Module created in order to setup the logger used in the package.

audio_emotion.logging_setup.configure_logger(logger=None, cfg=None, log_file=None, console=True, log_level='DEBUG')¶

Function to setup configurations of logger through function. The individual arguments of log_file, console, log_level will overwrite the ones in cfg. Parameters ———-

logger:

Predefined logger object if present. If None a new logger object will be created from root.

cfg: dict()

Configuration of the logging to be implemented by default

log_file: str

Path to the log file for logs to be stored

console: bool

To include a console handler(logs printing in console)

log_level: str

One of [“INFO”,”DEBUG”,”WARNING”,”ERROR”,”CRITICAL”] default - “DEBUG”

logging.Logger

audio_emotion.feature_extraction module¶

feature_extraction.py docstring

Module created for extracting and converting the feature from the data to a form which is needed for model creation.

Additionally it also splits the data to training and testing set.

audio_emotion.feature_extraction.df_split(df, data_folder)¶

Function to split the Dataframe to training and testing set.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

df: pd.Dataframe

Feature extracted Dataframe.

data_folder: StrOrBytesPath

The path where the data will be saved.

Training and testing data.

audio_emotion.feature_extraction.extract_split(ref, data_folder)¶

Function to combine all the functions in this module.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

ref: pd.Dataframe

Reference file containing the path to the audio files as well as the emotion associated with each audio.

data_folder: StrOrBytesPath

The path where the processed data needs to be saved.

Feature extracted dataframe and training and testing dataframes.

audio_emotion.feature_extraction.feature_extraction(ref, data_folder)¶

Function to extract feature from reference data. It also saves the extracted data for future use.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

ref: pd.Dataframe

Reference file containing the path to the audio files as well as the emotion associated with each audio.

data_folder: StrOrBytesPath

The path where the processed data needs to be saved.

A dataframe having emotion of the speaker categorized along with the features.

audio_emotion.basic_model module¶

basic_model.py docstring

Module created to do some basic modelling on our data.

Additionally it also saves the result as a seperate csv file and the model as a pickle file for future use.

audio_emotion.basic_model.baseline_test(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test, models)¶

Function to do some baseline tests on our data.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

X_train: pd.Dataframe

The features of training set.

X_test: pd.Dataframe

The features of testing set.

y_train: pd.Dataframe

Labels of the training set.

y_test: pd.Dataframe

Labels of the testing set.

models: Dict

Dictionary of the form {model_name: model} supplied by the use.

The result of the basic modelling.

audio_emotion.basic_model.get_data(path)¶

Function to load the train and test data and to divide it into features and labels.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

path: StrOrBytesPath

The path where from where the data is taken from.

Training and testing data divided as ‘X_train’, ‘X_test’, ‘y_train’ and ‘y_test’.

audio_emotion.basic_model.normalization(X_train, X_test)¶

Function to do some normalization on ‘X_train’ and ‘X_test’.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

X_train: pd.Dataframe

The features of training set.

X_test: pd.Dataframe

The features of testing set.

Normalized ‘X_train’ and ‘X_test’.

audio_emotion.basic_model.seq_model(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test, path)¶

Function to do sequential modelling on our data.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

X_train: pd.Dataframe

The features of training set.

X_test: pd.Dataframe

The features of testing set.

y_train: pd.Dataframe

Labels of the training set.

y_test: pd.Dataframe

Labels of the testing set.

path: StrOrBytesPath

Location where file is to be saved.

The result of the basic modelling.

audio_emotion.score module¶

score.py docstring

Module created for the purpose of determining how well our model performed on test data.

Primarily our model was designed to determine ‘gender_emotion’ of the speaker, here we have also added functions to determine its performance if only gender or emotion classification is done.

audio_emotion.score.class_report(df)¶

Function to do classification report on our dataframe.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

df: pd.Dataframe

The dataframe for which performance is to be determined.

Classification report of the dataframe based on the labels present.

audio_emotion.score.emotion_test(processed_path)¶

Function to do emotion classification on our data.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

processed_path: StrOrBytesPAth

The path where the processed data is saved.

The modified dataframe.

audio_emotion.score.gender_test(processed_path)¶

Function to predict gender classification on our data.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

processed_path: StrOrBytesPAth

The path where the processed data is saved.

The modified dataframe.

audio_emotion.score.load(processed_path, artifacts_path)¶

Function to load the data and model.

The default arguments of the function can be overwritten when supplied by the user

processed_path: StrOrBytesPAth

The path where the processed data needs to be saved.

data_folder: StrOrBytesPath

The path where the artifacts are needs to be saved.

Prediction Dataframe containing the ‘actualvalues’ and ‘predictionvalues’.

Data on which tuning is performed.

Function to do some normalization on ‘X_train’ and ‘X_test’.

The features of training set.
